text: The long jump event at the 1926 Women's World Games in Gothenburg at the Slottsskogsvallen was the second time the long jump was held at Women's World Games. Japanese Kinue Hitomi won the event with in a new world record of 5.50 meter. Behind her British Muriel Gunn finished second and Czechoslovak Zdena Smolová finished third. ==Records== This was the standing world record (in metres) prior to the 1926 Women's World Games. ==Results== Rank Name Nationality Distance (m) Notes Kinue Hitomi 5.50 Muriel Gunn 5.44 Zdena Smolová 5.26 or 5.28 4 5.16 5 Zinaida Liepiņa 5.00 6 ? ? ? 7 4.77 8 ? 9 Lucienne Laudré-Viel 4.63 10 Léontine Stevens 4.51 11 4.47 12 4.41 Josephine Matthews (?) ? title: 1926 Women's World Games – long jump
